ComputationalScience.WhatYouWillDo: The Inorganic, Isotope and Actinide Chemistry (C-IIAC) group is seeking an exceptional postdoctoral candidate to perform research in the area of fundamental bonding studies of the f-elements. The successful candidate will focus on the syntheses of ligands and complexes with lanthanides and actinides in pursuit of molecular moieties containing metal ions in unusual oxidation states or containing metal-ligand multiple bond character. Examples include plutonium and neptunium complexes in the +2 oxidation state, terminal oxo, sulfido groups, and imido species. The research approach requires extensive screening and synthetic protocol optimization, on small scales, with lanthanide and uranium surrogates before progressing to transuranic elements. As such, the position will entail a combination of non-radioactive reagent preparation and metal complexation testing with lanthanides/uranium, combined with extending those experiments to Np, Pu and Am transuranic elements.

The successful EES-14 Group Leader will serve as a member of the EES Division Leadership Team and will be expected to have a vision for the leadership of the Earth Systems Observations Group.  The EES-14 Group Leader will be responsible for strategic and tactical planning, in concert with Division leadership. The Earth Systems Observations Group (EES-14) performs primarily experimental and observational research that falls broadly across the geological, hydrological and atmospheric sciences. Experimental facilities include a well-equipped suite of geochemical analytical labs for the characterization of rocks and fluids; high pressure experimental equipment; a rad-capable hydrothermal experimental lab; triaxle core flood with in situ tomography and a high pressure load frame for studies of rock mechanical behavior under stress; high pressure-temperature microfluidics stage; and light stable isotope mass spectrometers and peripherals.
